verses.roman:
namo brahmaṇya-devāya
go-brāhmaṇa-hitāya ca
jagad-dhitāya kṛṣṇāya
govindāya namo namaḥ

synonyms: namaḥ—all obeisances; brahmaṇya-devāya—to the Lord worshipable by persons in brahminical culture; go-brāhmaṇa—for cows and brāhmaṇas; hitāya—beneficial; ca—also; jagat-hitāya—to one who always is benefiting the whole world; kṛṣṇāya—unto Kṛṣṇa; govindāya—unto Govinda; namaḥ namaḥ—repeated obeisances.
translation: " 'Let me offer my respectful obeisances unto Lord Kṛṣṇa, who is the worshipable Deity for all brahminical men, who is the well-wisher of cows and brāhmaṇas, and who is always benefiting the whole world. I offer my repeated obeisances to the Personality of Godhead, known as Kṛṣṇa and Govinda.'

purport.content: This is a quotation from the Viṣṇu Purāṇa (1.19.65).
